title: Hey guys, I am here to inform you...
body:
... that Lipton's drink Virgin Mojito Ice Tea is absolutely *Phenomenal*.

So do not, I repeat, Do **NOT **buy or drink Virgin Mojito even when it's free.

Oh I can see your morbid curiosity is now growing to take control over you, I can even smell it. Let me tell you why,

Every single sip reminds me of the toothpaste I use every morning, yes you heard right, pouring this thing down your throat is just like drinking toothpastes.

EWWWWWWWWWWWWWW!!!!!

I know it's because it has mint in there, but oh god, I am positive that they don't know the difference between genuine mint or toothpaste flavour.

It has to be the case where their "beta testers" drank too much flavours in his line of work, so much his tongue mutated into the next level of evolution beyond human comprehension. Yes, it has to be that, I can not understand why this is even a thing on the market. Why?

I shall repeat one last time, do not attempt consuming this thing called Lipton Virgin Mojito Ice Tea. You have been warned.
http://shop.coles.com.au/wcsstore/Coles-CAS/images/1/4/8/1481458.jpg

/mindless QQ

replies.body:
Phenomenal is a positive adjective.

> remarkable or exceptional, especially exceptionally good.

Lol all drink review sites give it about 4.6/5 rating

> REFRESHING! The mint makes you feel like your actually drinking a mojito without being naughty! Absolutely my favourite from Lipton!

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=rVT9AuVs,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-10-02T05:07:56.245+0000)
>
> Phenomenal is a positive adjective.
>
> Lol all drink review sites give it about 4.6/5 rating

(I used the term "phenomenal" in a sarcastic fashion, hence the italic)

Holy shit this necro lol (it really brings me back, especially the other commenters' igns... sniff).

Anyway, I haven't seen this drink anywhere around my general routine for a while now for some reason now that I think about it, so can't review my opinion even if I wanted to lol.

Still, my first impression with the flavour was incredibly poor (from 3 years ago.....), given that it reminds me personally of the flavour for toothpastes. Then again, opinions opinions.
Well regardless, its still around but they changed what goes into it, that "review" was from 4 weeks ago

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=rVT9AuVs,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2017-10-03T06:45:58.112+0000)
>
> Well regardless, its still around but they changed what goes into it, that "review" was from 4 weeks ago

Might retry at some point.
Citrus Green Tea is the superior flavour.

I bought 3 for my friends.

Aaaaaaaaaand then i read this post.

.____________________.

Just a small traumatic experience I had today, maybe it's just not for me aye.

The bottle is still sitting in my fridge atm, still thinking about how to finish it later.
Bury the bottle and book and see your local GP ASAP.
